step-intro.title: Intro
step-intro.p2: Before getting started some configuration information is required.

step-1.title: UAA Part 1
step-1.p1: [[@:product.console]] authenticates users with a Cloud Foundry User Account and Authentication (UAA) service. The console must be configured with the details necessary to communicate with the UAA.
step-1.p2: The address of the UAA api endpoint must be provided and whether SSL validation is required.
step-1.p3: The client credentials are required, including a UAA admin username and password.
step-1.p4: The configuration will be validated before moving on to the next step.
step-1.p5: For further information about Cloud Foundry UAA see here.

uaa-url-skip-ssl.label: Skip SSL validation for the endpoint

step-1.error-request: Unable to send setup information. If this error persists, please contact the Administrator.

step-2.title: UAA Part 2
step-2.p1: Basic configuration has been validated and a set of UAA scopes have been discovered.
step-2.p2: The Console uses a scope to identify Console administrators from regular users.
step-2.p3: Please select which scope you would like to use for this.

console-scope.label: Scope
console-scope.placeholder: UAA admin scope identifying console admin

step-2.error-request: Unable to send setup information. If this error persists, please contact the Administrator.
